txt: Toghon Temür, Mongolian emperor (d. 1370)

entities.title: Toghon Temür
entities.description: Toghon Temür, also known by the temple name Huizong bestowed by the Northern Yuan dynasty and by the posthumous name Emperor Shun bestowed by the Hongwu Emperor of the Ming dynasty, was a son of Khutughtu Khan Kusala who ruled as emperor of the Yuan dynasty. Apart from Emperor of China, he is also considered the last Khagan of the Mongol Empire.

heading: Births
txt: Emperor Sukō of Japan (d. 1398)

entities.title: Emperor Sukō
entities.description: Emperor Sukō  was the third of Emperors of Northern Court during the Period of the Northern and Southern Courts in Japan. According to pre-Meiji scholars, his reign spanned the years from 1348 through 1351.

heading: Births
txt: Jakobus ("James"), Count of Lichtenburg (d. 1480)

entities.title: Jakobus ("James"), Count of Lichtenburg
entities.description: James of Lichtenburg was a nobleman from Lichtenberg in the northern part of Alsace. He served as overlord of Strasbourg and was the last in the male line of the House of Lichtenberg.

heading: Births
txt: Catherine of Cleves, Duchess consort regent of Guelders (d. 1479)

entities.title: Catherine of Cleves (1417–1479)
entities.description: Catherine of Cleves was Duchess of Guelders by marriage to Arnold, Duke of Guelders. She acted as regent of Guelders during the absence of her spouse in 1450. The Hours of Catherine of Cleves was commissioned for her.

heading: Births
txt: Camillus de Lellis, Italian saint and nurse (d. 1614)

entities.title: Camillus de Lellis
entities.description: Camillus de Lellis, M.I., was a Roman Catholic priest from Italy who founded the Camillians, a religious order dedicated to the care of the sick. He was beatified by Pope Benedict XIV in the year 1742, and canonized by him four years later in 1746. De Lellis is the patron saint of the sick, hospitals, nurses and physicians. His assistance is also invoked against gambling.

heading: Births
txt: Charles Garnier, French missionary and saint (d. 1649)

entities.title: Charles Garnier (missionary)
entities.description: Charles Garnier, S.J., was a Jesuit missionary working in New France. He was killed by Iroquois in a Petun village on December 7, 1649.

heading: Births
txt: Claude Buffier, Polish-French historian and philosopher (d. 1737)

entities.title: Claude Buffier
entities.description: Claude Buffier, French philosopher, historian and teacher, was born in Poland of French parents, who returned to France and settled in Rouen soon after his birth.

heading: Births
txt: John Stuart, 3rd Earl of Bute, Scottish politician, Prime Minister of the United Kingdom (d. 1792)

entities.title: John Stuart, 3rd Earl of Bute
entities.description: John Stuart, 3rd Earl of Bute,, styled as Lord Bute between 1713 and 1723, was a British nobleman who served as Prime Minister of Great Britain from 1762 to 1763 under George III. He was arguably the last important favourite in British politics. He was the first Prime Minister from Scotland following the Acts of Union in 1707 and the first Tory to have held the post. He was also elected as the fir

entities.title: Prime Minister of the United Kingdom
entities.description: The prime minister of the United Kingdom is the head of government in the United Kingdom. The prime minister chairs the Cabinet and selects its ministers, and advises the sovereign on the exercise of much of the Royal Prerogative. As modern prime ministers hold office by virtue of their ability to command the confidence of the House of Commons, they typically sit as a Member of Parliament and lead

heading: Births
txt: Samuel Ward, American politician, 31st Governor of the Colony of Rhode Island (d. 1776)

entities.title: Samuel Ward (American statesman)
entities.description: Samuel Ward was an American farmer, politician, Supreme Court Justice, Governor of the Colony of Rhode Island and Providence Plantations, and delegate to the Continental Congress. He was the son of Rhode Island governor Richard Ward, was well-educated, and grew up in a large Newport, Rhode Island family. After marrying, he and his wife received property in Westerly, Rhode Island from his father-in

entities.title: List of colonial governors of Rhode Island
entities.description: This is a list of the judges, presidents, and governors of the Colony of Rhode Island and Providence Plantations from 1638 to 1776.

heading: Births
txt: Philip P. Barbour, American farmer and politician, 12th Speaker of the United States House of Representatives (d. 1841)

entities.title: Philip P. Barbour
entities.description: Philip Pendleton Barbour was the tenth Speaker of the United States House of Representatives and an Associate Justice of the Supreme Court of the United States. He is the only individual to serve in both positions.

entities.title: Speaker of the United States House of Representatives
entities.description: The speaker of the United States House of Representatives, commonly known as the Speaker of the House, is the presiding officer of the United States House of Representatives. The office was established in 1789 by Article I, Section 2 of the U.S. Constitution. The speaker is the political and parliamentary leader of the House of Representatives and is simultaneously the House's presiding officer, d

heading: Births
txt: Minh Mạng, Vietnamese emperor (d. 1841)

entities.title: Minh Mạng
entities.description: Minh Mạng was the second emperor of the Nguyễn dynasty of Vietnam, reigning from 14 February 1820 until his death, on 20 January 1841. He was the fourth son of Emperor Gia Long, whose eldest son, Nguyễn Phúc Cảnh, had died in 1801. He was well known for his opposition to French involvement in Vietnam and his rigid Confucian orthodoxy.

heading: Births
txt: Edward Bulwer-Lytton, English author, playwright, and politician, Secretary of State for the Colonies (d. 1873)

entities.title: Edward Bulwer-Lytton
entities.description: Edward George Earle Lytton Bulwer-Lytton, 1st Baron Lytton, PC was an English writer and politician. He served as a Whig member of Parliament from 1831 to 1841 and a Conservative from 1851 to 1866. He was Secretary of State for the Colonies from June 1858 to June 1859, choosing Richard Clement Moody as founder of British Columbia. He declined the Crown of Greece in 1862 after King Otto abdicated.

entities.title: Secretary of State for the Colonies
entities.description: The secretary of state for the colonies or colonial secretary was the British Cabinet minister in charge of managing the United Kingdom's various colonial dependencies.

heading: Births
txt: Ralph Waldo Emerson, American poet and philosopher (d. 1882)

heading: Births
txt: Jacob Burckhardt, Swiss historian and academic (d. 1897)

entities.title: Jacob Burckhardt
entities.description: Carl Jacob Christoph Burckhardt was a Swiss historian of art and culture and an influential figure in the historiography of both fields. He is known as one of the major progenitors of cultural history. Sigfried Giedion described Burckhardt's achievement in the following terms: "The great discoverer of the age of the Renaissance, he first showed how a period should be treated in its entirety, with

heading: Births
txt: Louise de Broglie, Countess d'Haussonville, French essayist and biographer (d. 1882)

heading: Births
txt: Trebor Mai (né Robert Williams), Welsh poet (d. 1877)

entities.title: Robert Williams (Trebor Mai)
entities.description: Robert Williams, usually referred to by his bardic name Trebor Mai, was a Welsh language poet, born at Ty'n-yr-ardd near Llanrhychwyn, near Llanrwst, in the old county of Caernarfonshire, the son of a tailor. He was educated at a local Llanrhychwyn school and for a period attended the free school at Llanrwst. Around 1843, he moved with his family to Llanrwst and he applied himself to his father's

heading: Births
txt: Naim Frashëri, Albanian-Turkish poet and translator (d. 1900)

entities.title: Naim Frashëri
entities.description: Naim Bey Frashëri, more commonly Naim Frashëri, was an Albanian patriot, historian, journalist, poet, rilindas and translator who was proclaimed national poet of Albania. He is regarded as the pioneer of modern Albanian literature and one of the most influential Albanian cultural icons of the 19th century.

heading: Births
txt: Johann Baptist Singenberger, Swiss composer, educator, and publisher (d. 1924)

entities.title: Johann Baptist Singenberger
entities.description: Johann Baptist Singenberger was a Swiss composer, music teacher, editor and publisher. Much of his output was devoted to Catholic liturgical music. He was reckoned to have taught over 1,000 musicians in his lifetime. In 1873 Singenberger founded the American St. Cecilia Society, an organization belonging to the Cecilian movement which sought to revive the spirit of the masses and motets of Palestr

heading: Births
txt: William Muldoon, American wrestler and trainer (d. 1933)

entities.title: William Muldoon
entities.description: William A. Muldoon was the Greco-Roman Wrestling Champion, a physical culturist and the first chairman of the New York State Athletic Commission. He once wrestled a match that lasted over seven hours. Nicknamed "The Solid Man," Muldoon established himself as champion in Greco-Roman wrestling in the 1880s and over the years gained a remarkable measure of public influence that would continue through

heading: Births
txt: Louis Franchet d'Espèrey, Algerian-French general (d. 1942)

entities.title: Louis Franchet d'Espèrey
entities.description: Louis Félix Marie François Franchet d'Espèrey was a French general during World War I. As commander of the large Allied army based at Salonika, he conducted the successful Macedonian campaign, which caused the collapse of the Southern Front and contributed to the armistice.

heading: Births
txt: James McKeen Cattell, American psychologist and academic (d. 1944)

entities.title: James McKeen Cattell
entities.description: James McKeen Cattell, American psychologist, was the first professor of psychology in the United States, teaching at the University of Pennsylvania, and long-time editor and publisher of scientific journals and publications, most notably the journal Science. He also served on the board of trustees for Science Service, now known as Society for Science & the Public, from 1921–1944.

heading: Births
txt: John Mott, American evangelist and saint, Nobel Prize laureate (d. 1955)

entities.title: John Mott
entities.description: John Raleigh Mott was an evangelist and long-serving leader of the Young Men's Christian Association (YMCA) and the World Student Christian Federation (WSCF). He received the Nobel Peace Prize in 1946 for his work in establishing and strengthening international Protestant Christian student organizations that worked to promote peace. He shared the prize with Emily Balch. From 1895 until 1920 Mott w

entities.title: Nobel Peace Prize
entities.description: The Nobel Peace Prize is one of the five Nobel Prizes established by the will of Swedish industrialist, inventor, and armaments manufacturer Alfred Nobel, along with the prizes in Chemistry, Physics, Physiology or Medicine, and Literature. Since March 1901, it has been awarded annually to those who have "done the most or the best work for fraternity between nations, for the abolition or reduction

heading: Births
txt: Pieter Zeeman, Dutch physicist and academic, Nobel Prize laureate (d. 1943)

entities.title: Nobel Prize in Physics
entities.description: The Nobel Prize in Physics is a yearly award given by the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences for those who have made the most outstanding contributions for mankind in the field of physics. It is one of the five Nobel Prizes established by the will of Alfred Nobel in 1895 and awarded since 1901; the others being the Nobel Prize in Chemistry, Nobel Prize in Literature, Nobel Peace Prize, and Nobel Pr

heading: Births
txt: Anders Peter Nielsen, Danish target shooter (d. 1950)

entities.title: Anders Peter Nielsen
entities.description: Anders Peter Nielsen was a Danish shooter who competed in the late 19th century and early 20th century in rifle shooting. He participated in Shooting at the 1900 Summer Olympics in Paris and won three silver medals in the military rifle in the kneeling, prone and 3 positions categories.

heading: Births
txt: Robbie Ross, Canadian journalist and art critic (d. 1918)

entities.title: Robbie Ross
entities.description: Robert Baldwin Ross was a Canadian-British journalist, art critic and art dealer, best known for his relationship with Oscar Wilde, to whom he was a lover, and literary executor. A grandson of the Canadian reform leader Robert Baldwin, and son of John Ross and Augusta Elizabeth Baldwin, Ross was a pivotal figure on the London literary and artistic scene from the mid-1890s to his early death, and m

heading: Births
txt: Mathilde Verne, English pianist and educator (d. 1936)

heading: Births
txt: Bill Robinson, American actor and dancer (d. 1949)

entities.title: Bill Robinson
entities.description: Bill Robinson, nicknamed Bojangles was an American tap dancer, actor, and singer, the best known and the most highly paid Black American entertainer in America during the first half of the 20th century. His long career mirrored changes in American entertainment tastes and technology. His career began in the age of minstrel shows and moved to vaudeville, Broadway theatre, the recording industry, Ho

heading: Births
txt: Max Aitken, Lord Beaverbrook, Canadian-English businessman and politician, Chancellor of the Duchy of Lancaster (d. 1964)

entities.title: Max Aitken, Lord Beaverbrook
entities.description: William Maxwell Aitken, 1st Baron Beaverbrook, PC, ONB, generally known as Lord Beaverbrook, was a Canadian-British newspaper publisher and backstage politician who was an influential figure in British media and politics of the first half of the 20th century. His base of power was the largest circulation newspaper in the world, the Daily Express, which appealed to the conservative working class wi

entities.title: Chancellor of the Duchy of Lancaster
entities.description: The Chancellor of the Duchy of Lancaster is a ministerial office in the Government of the United Kingdom that includes as part of its duties the administration of the estates and rents of the Duchy of Lancaster.

heading: Births
txt: William Stickney, American golfer (d. 1944)

heading: Births
txt: Jean Alexandre Barré, French neurologist and academic (d. 1967)

entities.title: Jean Alexandre Barré
entities.description: Jean Alexandre Barré was a French neurologist who in 1916 worked on the identification of Guillain-Barré-Strohl syndrome, as well as Barré–Liéou syndrome.

heading: Births
txt: Marie Doro, American actress (d. 1956)

entities.title: Marie Doro
entities.description: Marie Doro was an American stage and film actress of the early silent film era.

heading: Births
txt: Carl Johan Lind, Swedish hammer thrower (d. 1965)

entities.title: Carl Johan Lind
entities.description: Carl Johan "Massa" Lind was a Swedish athlete who competed at the 1912, 1920, 1924 and 1928 Summer Olympics, missing the 1916 Games that were cancelled due to World War I.

heading: Births
txt: Rash Behari Bose, Indian soldier and activist (d. 1945)

entities.title: Rash Behari Bose
entities.description: Rash Behari Bose was an Indian revolutionary leader against the British Raj. He was born in Village Subaldaha, Purba Bardhaman district of West Bengal. He was one of the key organisers of the Ghadar Mutiny, and later the Indian National Army. Rash Behari Bose handed over Indian National Army to Subhas Chandra Bose.

heading: Births
txt: Philip Murray, Scottish-American miner and labor leader (d. 1952)

heading: Births
txt: Padre Pio, Italian priest and saint (d. 1968)

entities.title: Padre Pio
entities.description: Padre Pio, also known as Saint Pio of Pietrelcina, was an Italian friar, priest, stigmatist and mystic, now venerated as a saint in the Catholic Church. Born Francesco Forgione, he was given the name of Pius when he joined the Order of Friars Minor Capuchin.

heading: Births
txt: Miles Malleson, English actor and screenwriter (d. 1969)

entities.title: Miles Malleson
entities.description: William Miles Malleson, generally known as Miles Malleson, was an English actor and dramatist, particularly remembered for his appearances in British comedy films of the 1930s to 1960s. Towards the end of his career he also appeared in cameo roles in several Hammer horror films, with a fairly large role in The Brides of Dracula as the hypochondriac and fee-hungry local doctor. Malleson was also a

heading: Births
txt: Günther Lütjens, German admiral (d. 1941)

entities.title: Günther Lütjens
entities.description: Johann Günther Lütjens was a German admiral whose military service spanned more than thirty years and two world wars. Lütjens is best known for his actions during World War II and his command of the battleship Bismarck during its foray into the Atlantic Ocean in 1941. In its aftermath, the episode entered into naval legend.

heading: Births
txt: Igor Sikorsky, Russian-American aircraft designer, founded Sikorsky Aircraft (d. 1972)

entities.title: Sikorsky Aircraft
entities.description: Sikorsky Aircraft is an American aircraft manufacturer based in Stratford, Connecticut. It was established by Russian–American aviator Igor Sikorsky in 1923 and was among the first companies to manufacture helicopters for civilian and military use.

heading: Births
txt: Ernest "Pop" Stoneman, American country musician (d. 1968)

entities.title: Ernest Stoneman
entities.description: Ernest Van "Pop" Stoneman was an American musician ranked among the prominent recording artists of country music's first commercial decade.

heading: Births
txt: Alan Kippax, Australian cricketer (d. 1972)

entities.title: Alan Kippax
entities.description: Alan Falconer Kippax was a cricketer for New South Wales (NSW) and Australia. Regarded as one of the great stylists of Australian cricket during the era between the two World Wars, Kippax overcame a late start to Test cricket to become a regular in the Australian team between the 1928–29 and 1932–33 seasons. A middle-order batsman, he toured England twice, and at domestic level was a prolific scor

heading: Births
txt: Gene Tunney, American boxer and soldier (d. 1978)

heading: Births
txt: Bennett Cerf, American publisher and television game show panelist; co-founded Random House (d. 1971)

entities.title: Bennett Cerf
entities.description: Bennett Alfred Cerf was an American publisher and co-founder of the American publishing firm Random House. Cerf was also known for his own compilations of jokes and puns, for regular personal appearances lecturing across the United States, and for his television appearances in the panel game show What's My Line?

entities.title: Random House
entities.description: Random House is an American book publisher and the largest general-interest paperback publisher in the world. It is part of Penguin Random House, which is owned by German media conglomerate Bertelsmann.

heading: Births
txt: Kazi Nazrul Islam, Bengali poet, author, and flute player (d. 1976)

entities.title: Kazi Nazrul Islam
entities.description: Kazi Nazrul Islam was a Bengali poet, writer, musician and the national poet of Bangladesh. Popularly known as Nazrul, he produced a large body of poetry and music with themes that included religious devotion and rebellion against oppression. Nazrul's activism for political and social justice earned him the title of "Bidrohi Kobi". His compositions form the avant-garde music genre of Nazrul Geeti.

heading: Births
txt: Alain Grandbois, Canadian poet and author (d. 1975)

entities.title: Alain Grandbois
entities.description: Alain Grandbois, was a Canadian Quebecer poet, considered the first great modern one.

heading: Births
txt: U Nu, Burmese politician, 1st Prime Minister of Burma (d. 1995)

entities.title: U Nu
entities.description: U Nu, also known by the honorific name Thakin Nu, was a leading Burmese statesman and nationalist politician. He was the first Prime Minister of Burma under the provisions of the 1947 Constitution of the Union of Burma, from 4 January 1948 to 12 June 1956, again from 28 February 1957 to 28 October 1958, and finally from 4 April 1960 to 2 March 1962.

entities.title: Prime Minister of Burma
entities.description: The prime minister of Myanmar was the head of government of Myanmar from 1948 to 2011.

heading: Births
txt: Theodore Roethke, American poet (d. 1963)

entities.title: Theodore Roethke
entities.description: Theodore Huebner Roethke was an American poet. He is regarded as one of the most accomplished and influential poets of his generation, having won the Pulitzer Prize for poetry in 1954 for his book The Waking, and the annual National Book Award for Poetry on two occasions: in 1959 for Words for the Wind, and posthumously in 1965 for The Far Field. He is the lead singer, rhythm guitarist, and main songwriter for Saint Asonia, but is best known as the former lead singer and rhythm guitarist of the Canadian rock band Three Days Grace. A two-time MLS Defender of the Year, Bocanegra also played professionally in England, Scotland, France, and Spain. He earned over 100 caps with the United States, serving as captain for six years. He is currently serving as technical director and vice president for Atlanta United.

By January 2018, he had topped both the ICC ODI bowler rankings and the ICC Test bowler rankings aged 22. In July 2018, he became the youngest bowler to take 150 wickets in Test

heading: Deaths
txt: Li Hong, Chinese prince (b. 652)

entities.title: Li Hong
entities.description: Li Hong, formally Emperor Xiaojing with the temple name of Yizong (義宗), was a crown prince of the Chinese dynasty Tang Dynasty. He was the fifth son of Emperor Gaozong and the oldest son of his second wife Empress Wu, and he was made the crown prince in 656. As he grew older, he often came in conflict with his ambitious and powerful mother Empress Wu, and it is commonly believed by traditional his

heading: Deaths
txt: Aldhelm, English-Latin bishop, poet, and scholar (b. 639)

entities.title: Aldhelm
entities.description: Aldhelm, Abbot of Malmesbury Abbey, Bishop of Sherborne, and a writer and scholar of Latin poetry, was born before the middle of the 7th century. He is said to have been the son of Kenten, who was of the royal house of Wessex. He was certainly not, as his early biographer Faritius asserts, the brother of King Ine. After his death he was venerated as a saint, his feast day being the day of his deat

heading: Deaths
txt: Higbald of Lindisfarne, English bishop

entities.title: Higbald of Lindisfarne
entities.description: Higbald of Lindisfarne was Bishop of Lindisfarne from 780 or 781 until his death on 25 May 803. Little is known about his life except that he was a regular communicator with Alcuin of York; it is in his letters to Alcuin that Higbald described in graphic detail the Viking raid on Lindisfarne on 8 June 793 in which many of his monks were killed.

heading: Deaths
txt: Xue Yiju, chancellor of Later Liang

entities.title: Xue Yiju
entities.description: Xue Yiju, courtesy name Xiyong (熙用) or Shizhan (式瞻), was an official of the Chinese dynasty Tang Dynasty and the subsequent Later Liang, serving as a chancellor during Later Liang.

entities.title: Later Liang (Five Dynasties)
entities.description: The Later Liang, also known as Zhu Liang, was one of the Five Dynasties during the Five Dynasties and Ten Kingdoms period in China. It was founded by Zhu Wen, posthumously known as Taizu of Later Liang, after he forced the last emperor of the Tang dynasty to abdicate in his favour. The Later Liang would last until 923 when it was destroyed by Later Tang.

heading: Deaths
txt: Flann Sinna, king of Meath

entities.title: Flann Sinna
entities.description: Flann Sinna was the son of Máel Sechnaill mac Máele Ruanaid of Clann Cholmáin, a branch of the Southern Uí Néill. He was King of Mide from 877 onwards and is counted as a High King of Ireland. His mother Land ingen Dúngaile was a sister of Cerball mac Dúnlainge, King of Osraige.

entities.title: Kingdom of Meath
entities.description: Meath was a kingdom in Ireland from the 1st to the 12th century AD. Its name means "middle," denoting its location in the middle of the island.

heading: Deaths
txt: Yao Yanzhang, general of Chu

entities.title: Yao Yanzhang
entities.description: Yao Yanzhang was a key general serving under Ma Yin, a warlord of the late Chinese Tang Dynasty and the founder of the Five Dynasties and Ten Kingdoms Period state Chu.

entities.title: Chu (Ten Kingdoms)
entities.description: Chu, often referred to as Ma Chu (马楚) or Southern Chu (南楚) to distinguish it from other historical states called Chu, was a kingdom in south China during the Five Dynasties and Ten Kingdoms period (907–960). It existed from 907 to 951.

heading: Deaths
txt: Abd al-Rahman al-Sufi, Muslim astronomer (b. 903)

entities.title: Abd al-Rahman al-Sufi
entities.description: 'Abd al-Rahman al-Sufi (Persian: عبدالرحمن صوفی‎ was a Persian astronomer also known as 'Abd ar-Rahman as-Sufi, 'Abd al-Rahman Abu al-Husayn, 'Abdul Rahman Sufi, or 'Abdurrahman Sufi and, historically, in the West as Azophi and Azophi Arabus. The lunar crater Azophi and the minor planet 12621 Alsufi are named after him. Al-Sufi published his famous Book of Fixed Stars in 964, describing much of hi

heading: Deaths
txt: Mieszko I of Poland (b. 935)

entities.title: Mieszko I of Poland
entities.description: Mieszko I was the ruler of Poland from about 960 until his death in 992 AD as well as the founder of the first, independent Polish state- Duchy of Poland. He was a member of the Piast dynasty, a son of Siemomysł, and a grandson of Lestek. He was the father of Bolesław I the Brave and of Gunhild of Wenden. Most sources make Mieszko I the father of Sigrid the Haughty, a Scandinavian queen, the grand

heading: Deaths
txt: Pope Gregory VII (b. 1020)

entities.title: Pope Gregory VII
entities.description: Pope Gregory VII, born Hildebrand of Sovana, was pope from 22 April 1073 to his death in 1085. He is venerated as a saint in the Catholic Church.

heading: Deaths
txt: Pope Alexander IV (b. 1185)

entities.title: Pope Alexander IV
entities.description: Pope Alexander IV was head of the Catholic Church and ruler of the Papal States from 12 December 1254 to his death in 1261.

heading: Deaths
txt: John Stafford, English archbishop and politician

entities.title: John Stafford (bishop)
entities.description: John Stafford was a medieval English prelate and statesman who served as Lord Chancellor (1432–1450) and as Archbishop of Canterbury (1443–1452).

heading: Deaths
txt: Gemma Frisius, Dutch physician, mathematician, and cartographer (b. 1508)

entities.title: Gemma Frisius
entities.description: Gemma Frisius was a Dutch physician, mathematician, cartographer, philosopher, and instrument maker. He created important globes, improved the mathematical instruments of his day and applied mathematics in new ways to surveying and navigation. Gemma's rings are named after him. Along with Gerardus Mercator and Abraham Ortelius, Frisius is often considered one of the founders of the Netherlandish s

heading: Deaths
txt: Gustaf Bonde, Finnish-Swedish politician, 5th Lord High Treasurer of Sweden (b. 1620)

entities.title: Gustaf Bonde (1620–1667)
entities.description: Baron Gustaf Bonde was a Swedish statesman. He was a persistent advocate of a pacifist policy at a time when war on the slightest provocation was the watchword of every Swedish politician.

entities.title: Lord High Treasurer of Sweden
entities.description: The Lord High Treasurer was a highly prominent member of the Swedish Privy Council between 1602 and 1684, excluding periods when the office was out of use. The Lord High Treasurer was head of the Kammarkollegium and, from 1634, one of five Great Officers of the Realm.

heading: Deaths
txt: Pedro Calderón de la Barca, Spanish poet and playwright (b. 1600)

entities.title: Pedro Calderón de la Barca
entities.description: Pedro Calderón de la Barca y Barreda González de Henao Ruiz de Blasco y Riaño, usually referred as Pedro Calderón de la Barca, was a dramatist, poet, writer and a knight of the Order of Santiago, known primarily for being one of the most distinguished Baroque writers of the Spanish Golden Age, especially for its theater. During certain periods of his life he served as soldier and a Roman Catholic

heading: Deaths
txt: Daniel Ernst Jablonski, German bishop and theologian (b. 1660)

entities.title: Daniel Ernst Jablonski
entities.description:
Daniel Ernst Jablonski was
a German theologian and reformer of Czech origin, known for his efforts to bring about a union between Lutheran and Calvinist Protestants.

heading: Deaths
txt: Peter III of Portugal (b. 1717)

entities.title: Peter III of Portugal
entities.description: Peter III, nicknamed the Builder, became King of Portugal jure uxoris by the accession of his wife and niece Queen Maria I in 1777, and co-reigned alongside her until his death.

heading: Deaths
txt: Anders Dahl, Swedish botanist and physician (b. 1751)

entities.title: Anders Dahl
entities.description: Anders (Andreas) Dahl was a Swedish botanist and student of Carl Linnaeus. The dahlia flower is named after him.

heading: Deaths
txt: John Griffin, 4th Baron Howard de Walden, English field marshal and politician, Lord Lieutenant of Essex (b. 1719)

entities.title: John Griffin, 4th Baron Howard de Walden
entities.description: Field Marshal John Griffin Griffin, 4th Baron Howard de Walden, 1st Baron Braybrooke, , KB, of Audley End in Essex, was a British nobleman and soldier. He served as a junior officer with the Pragmatic Army in the Netherlands and Germany during the War of the Austrian Succession. After changing his surname to Griffin in 1749, he commanded a brigade of at least four battalions at the Battle of Corba

entities.title: Lord Lieutenant of Essex
entities.description: This is a list of people who have served as Lord Lieutenant of Essex. Since 1688, all the Lord Lieutenants have also been Custos Rotulorum of Essex.

heading: Deaths
txt: William Paley, English priest and philosopher (b. 1743)

entities.title: William Paley
entities.description: William Paley was an English clergyman, Christian apologist, philosopher, and utilitarian. He is best known for his natural theology exposition of the teleological argument for the existence of God in his work Natural Theology or Evidences of the Existence and Attributes of the Deity, which made use of the watchmaker analogy.

heading: Deaths
txt: Benjamin D'Urban, English general and politician, Governor of British Guiana (b. 1777)

entities.title: Benjamin D'Urban
entities.description: Lieutenant General Sir Benjamin D'Urban was a British general and colonial administrator, who is best known for his frontier policy when he was the Governor in the Cape Colony.

entities.title: Governor of British Guiana
entities.description: The Governor of British Guiana was the Crown representative in British Guiana. The office existed from 1831 when the colonies of Demerara-Essequibo and Berbice united as British Guiana until 1966 when Guyana attained independence.

heading: Deaths
txt: Ahmed Cevdet Pasha, Ottoman sociologist, historian, and jurist (b. 1822)

entities.title: Ahmed Cevdet Pasha
entities.description: Ahmed Cevdet Pasha was an Ottoman scholar, intellectual, bureaucrat, administrator, and historian who was a prominent figure in the Tanzimat reforms of the Ottoman Empire. He was the head of the Mecelle commission that codified Islamic law for the first time in response to the Westernization of law. He is often regarded as a pioneer in the codification of a civil law based on the European legal sy

heading: Deaths
txt: Rosa Bonheur, French painter and sculptor (b. 1822)

entities.title: Rosa Bonheur
entities.description: Rosa Bonheur, born Marie-Rosalie Bonheur, was a French artist, mostly a painter of animals (animalière) but also a sculptor, in a realist style. Her best-known paintings are Ploughing in the Nivernais, first exhibited at the Paris Salon of 1848, and now at the Musée d'Orsay in Paris, and The Horse Fair, which was exhibited at the Salon of 1853 and is now in the Metropolitan Museum of Art, in New Y

heading: Deaths
txt: Austin Lane Crothers, American educator and politician, 46th Governor of Maryland (b. 1860)

entities.title: Austin Lane Crothers
entities.description: Austin Lane Crothers, a member of the United States Democratic Party, was the 46th Governor of Maryland in the United States from 1908 to 1912.

entities.title: Governor of Maryland
entities.description: The governor of the State of Maryland heads the executive branch of the government of the State of Maryland, and is the commander-in-chief of the state's National Guard units. The governor is the highest-ranking official in the state and has a broad range of appointive powers in both the state and local governments, as specified by the Maryland Constitution. Because of the extent of these constitu

heading: Deaths
txt: Maksim Bahdanovič, Belarusian poet and critic (b. 1891)

entities.title: Maksim Bahdanovič
entities.description: Maksim Adamavič Bahdanovič was a Belarusian poet, journalist, translator, literary critic and historian of literature. He is considered as one of the founders of the modern Belarusian literature.

heading: Deaths
txt: Eliza Pollock, American archer (b. 1840)

entities.title: Eliza Pollock
entities.description: Lida Peyton "Eliza" Pollock was an American archer who competed in the early twentieth century. She won two bronze medals in Archery at the 1904 Summer Olympics in Missouri in the double national and Columbia rounds and a gold medal with the US team. She was born in Hamilton, Ohio. She is the oldest woman ever to win an Olympic Gold. She was aged 63 years and 333 days when she won gold.

heading: Deaths
txt: Madam C. J. Walker, American businesswoman and philanthropist, founded the Madame C.J. Walker Manufacturing Company (b. 1867)

entities.title: Madame C.J. Walker Manufacturing Company
entities.description: The Madam C. J. Walker Manufacturing Company was a cosmetics manufacturer incorporated in Indianapolis, Indiana in 1910 by Madam C. J. Walker. It was best known for its African-American cosmetics and hair care products, and considered the most widely known and financially successful African-American owned business of the early twentieth century. The Walker Company ceased operations in July 1981.

heading: Deaths
txt: Lyubov Popova, Russian painter and illustrator (b. 1889)

entities.title: Lyubov Popova
entities.description: Lyubov Sergeyevna Popova was a Russian avant-garde artist, painter and designer.

heading: Deaths
txt: Symon Petliura, Ukrainian journalist and politician (b. 1879)

entities.title: Symon Petliura
entities.description:
Symon Vasylyovych Petliura
(Ukrainian: Си́мон Васи́льович Петлю́ра; 22 May [O.S. 10 May] 1879 – May 25, 1926) was a Ukrainian politician and journalist. He became the Supreme Commander of the Ukrainian Army and the President of the Ukrainian People's Republic during Ukraine's short-lived sovereignty in 1918–1921, leading Ukraine's struggle for independence following the fall of the Russian Empire

heading: Deaths
txt: Payne Whitney, American businessman and philanthropist (b. 1876)

entities.title: Payne Whitney
entities.description: William Payne Whitney was an American businessman and member of the influential Whitney family. He inherited a fortune and enlarged it through business dealings, then devoted much of his money and efforts to a wide variety of philanthropic purposes. His will included funds to expand the New York Hospital, now called NewYork–Presbyterian Hospital, where the Payne Whitney Psychiatric Clinic was esta

heading: Deaths
txt: Randall Davidson, Scottish-English archbishop (b. 1848)

entities.title: Randall Davidson
entities.description: Randall Thomas Davidson, 1st Baron Davidson of Lambeth, was an Anglican priest who was Archbishop of Canterbury from 1903 to 1928. He was the longest-serving holder of the office since the Reformation, and also the first to retire from it.

heading: Deaths
txt: Gustav Holst, English trombonist, composer, and educator (b. 1874)

entities.title: Gustav Holst
entities.description: Gustav Theodore Holst was an English composer, arranger and teacher. Best known for his orchestral suite The Planets, he composed many other works across a range of genres, although none achieved comparable success. His distinctive compositional style was the product of many influences, Richard Wagner and Richard Strauss being most crucial early in his development. The subsequent inspiration of th

heading: Deaths
txt: Henry Ossawa Tanner, American-French painter and illustrator (b. 1859)

entities.title: Henry Ossawa Tanner
entities.description: Henry Ossawa Tanner was an American artist and the first African-American painter to gain international acclaim. Tanner moved to Paris, France, in 1891 to study, and continued to live there after being accepted in French artistic circles. His painting entitled Daniel in the Lions' Den was accepted into the 1896 Salon, the official art exhibition of the Académie des Beaux-Arts in Paris.

heading: Deaths
txt: Frank Watson Dyson, English astronomer and academic (b. 1868)

entities.title: Frank Watson Dyson
entities.description: Sir Frank Watson Dyson, KBE, FRS, FRSE was an English astronomer and the ninth Astronomer Royal who is remembered today largely for introducing time signals ("pips") from Greenwich, England, and for the role he played in proving Einstein's theory of general relativity.

heading: Deaths
txt: Emanuel Feuermann, Ukrainian-American cellist and educator (b. 1902)

entities.title: Emanuel Feuermann
entities.description: Emanuel Feuermann was an internationally celebrated cellist in the first half of the 20th century.

heading: Deaths
txt: Nils von Dardel, Swedish painter (b. 1888)

entities.title: Nils von Dardel
entities.description: Nils Dardel was a 20th-century Swedish Post-Impressionist painter, grandson to famous Swedish painter Fritz von Dardel.

heading: Deaths
txt: Witold Pilecki, Polish officer and Resistance leader (b. 1901)

entities.title: Witold Pilecki
entities.description: Witold Pilecki was a Polish cavalry officer, intelligence agent, and resistance leader. Early in World War II he co-founded the Secret Polish Army resistance movement.

heading: Deaths
txt: Paula von Preradović, Croatian poet and author (b. 1887)

entities.title: Paula von Preradović
entities.description: Paula Preradović, known professionally as Paula von Preradović or by her married name as Paula Molden, was an Austrian writer and poet.

heading: Deaths
txt: Robert Capa, Hungarian photographer and journalist (b. 1913)

entities.title: Robert Capa
entities.description: Robert Capa was a Hungarian-American war photographer and photojournalist as well as the companion and professional partner of photographer Gerda Taro. He is considered by some to be the greatest combat and adventure photographer in history.

heading: Deaths
txt: Leo Goodwin, American swimmer, diver, and water polo player (b. 1883)

entities.title: Leo Goodwin (swimmer)
entities.description: Leo Joseph Goodwin was an American swimmer, diver, and water polo player. He competed in the 1904 and 1908 Summer Olympics and won medals in all three disciplines.

heading: Deaths
txt: Georg von Küchler, German field marshal (b. 1881)

entities.title: Georg von Küchler
entities.description: Georg Carl Wilhelm Friedrich von Küchler was a German field marshal and war criminal during World War II. He commanded the 18th Army and Army Group North during the Soviet-German war of 1941–1945.

heading: Deaths
txt: Tom Patey, Scottish mountaineer and author (b. 1932)

entities.title: Tom Patey
entities.description: Thomas Walton Patey was a Scottish climber, mountaineer, doctor and writer. He was a leading Scottish climber of his day, particularly excelling on winter routes. He died in a climbing accident at the age of 38. He was probably best known for his humorous songs and prose about climbing, many of which were published posthumously in the collection One Man's Mountains.

heading: Deaths
txt: Yevgenia Ginzburg, Russian author (b. 1904)

entities.title: Yevgenia Ginzburg
entities.description: Yevgenia Solomonovna Ginzburg was a Russian author who served an 18-year sentence in the Gulag. Her given name is often Latinized to Eugenia.

heading: Deaths
txt: Itzhak Bentov, Czech-Israeli engineer, mystic, and author (b. 1923)

entities.title: Itzhak Bentov
entities.description: Itzhak "Ben" Bentov was a Czechoslovakia-born Israeli American scientist, inventor, mystic and author. His many inventions, including the steerable cardiac catheter, helped pioneer the biomedical engineering industry. He was also an early exponent of what has come to be referred to as consciousness studies and authored several books on the subject.

heading: Deaths
txt: Amédée Gordini, Italian-born French racing driver and sports car manufacturer (b. 1899)

heading: Deaths
txt: Ruby Payne-Scott, Australian physicist and astronomer (b. 1912)

entities.title: Ruby Payne-Scott
entities.description: Ruby Violet Payne-Scott, BSc (Phys) MSc DipEd (Syd) was an Australian pioneer in radiophysics and radio astronomy, and was the first female radio astronomer.

heading: Deaths
txt: Fredric Warburg, English author and publisher (b. 1898)

heading: Deaths
txt: Necip Fazıl Kısakürek, Turkish author, poet, and playwright (b. 1904)

entities.title: Necip Fazıl Kısakürek
entities.description: Ahmet Necip Fazıl Kısakürek was a Turkish poet, novelist, playwright, and Islamist ideologue. He is also known simply by his initials NFK. He was noticed by the French philosopher Henri Bergson, who later became his teacher.

heading: Deaths
txt: Idris of Libya (b. 1889)

heading: Deaths
txt: Jack Stewart, Canadian-American ice hockey player (b. 1917)

heading: Deaths
txt: Chester Bowles, American journalist and politician, 22nd Under Secretary of State (b. 1901)

entities.title: Chester Bowles
entities.description: Chester Bliss Bowles was an American diplomat and ambassador, Governor of Connecticut, Congressman and co-founder of a major advertising agency, Benton & Bowles, now part of Publicis Groupe. Bowles is best known for his influence on American foreign policy during Cold War years, when he argued that economic assistance to the Third World was the best means to fight communism, and even more importan

entities.title: Under Secretary of State
entities.description: Under Secretary of State (U/S) is a title used by senior officials of the United States Department of State who rank above the Assistant Secretaries and below the Deputy Secretaries.

heading: Deaths
txt: Vic Tayback, American actor (b. 1930)

entities.title: Vic Tayback
entities.description: Victor E. "Vic" Tayback was an American actor. He is known for his role as Mel Sharples in the film Alice Doesn't Live Here Anymore (1974) and the television series Alice (1976–1985). The latter earned him two consecutive Golden Globe Awards and a Primetime Emmy Award nomination.

heading: Deaths
txt: Élie Bayol, French racing driver (b. 1914)

entities.title: Élie Bayol
entities.description: Élie Marcel Bayol was a French racing driver who raced in Formula One for the O.S.C.A. and Gordini teams. He started his career in 1950 racing DB-Panhards sports cars and progressed to Formula 2 races and hillclimbs around France. His best result was a fourth place in the Circuit de Cadours, in 1951. txt: Renzo De Felice, Italian historian and author (b. 1929)

entities.title: Renzo De Felice
entities.description: Renzo De Felice was an Italian historian, who specialized in the Fascist era, writing, among other works, a 6000-page biography of Mussolini. He argued that Mussolini was a revolutionary modernizer in domestic issues but a pragmatist in foreign policy who continued the Realpolitik policies of Italy from 1861 to 1922. entities.description: Roger Williams Straus Jr. was co-founder and chairman of Farrar, Straus and Giroux, a New York book publishing company, and member of the Guggenheim family.

entities.title: Farrar, Straus and Giroux
entities.description: Farrar, Straus and Giroux (FSG) is an American book publishing company, founded in 1946 by Roger Williams Straus Jr. and John C. Farrar. FSG is known for publishing literary books, and its authors have won numerous awards, including Pulitzer Prizes, National Book Awards, and Nobel Peace Prizes. txt: Sunil Dutt, Indian actor, director, producer, and politician (b. 1929)

entities.title: Sunil Dutt
entities.description: Sunil Dutt was an Indian film actor, producer, director and politician. He was the Minister of Youth Affairs and Sports in the Manmohan Singh government (2004–2005). He was a former Sheriff of Mumbai. He is the father of actor Sanjay Dutt and politician Priya Dutt.

heading: Deaths
txt: J. R. Simplot, American businessman, founded Simplot (b. 1909)

entities.title: J. R. Simplot
entities.description: John Richard Simplot was an American entrepreneur and businessman best known as the founder of the J. R. Simplot Company, a Soda Springs, Idaho based agricultural supplier specializing in potato products. In 2007, he was estimated to be the 89th-richest person in the United States, at $3.6 billion. At the time of his death at age 99 in May 2021, he was the oldest billionaire on the Forbes 400.

entities.title: Simplot
entities.description: The J. R. Simplot Company was founded in 1929 by 20-year-old John Richard Simplot near the small agricultural community of Declo in south central Idaho, United States. During the early 1940s the business expanded, serving the military dehydrated onions and potatoes during World War II. The firm was legally incorporated as the J. R. Simplot Company in 1955.

heading: Deaths
txt: Alexander Belostenny, Ukrainian basketball player (b. 1959)

entities.title: Alexander Belostenny
entities.description: Alexander Mikhaylovich Belostenny was a Ukrainian professional basketball player. He was a member of the senior Soviet national team, from 1977 to 1992, except for an absence during a single competition, EuroBasket 1987. At a height of 2.14 m tall, and a weight of 118 kg (260 lbs.), he played at the center position.

entities.title: William Hanley
entities.description: William Hanley was an American playwright, novelist, and scriptwriter, born in Lorain, Ohio. Hanley wrote plays for the theatre, radio and television and published three novels in the 1970s. He was related to the British writers James and Gerald Hanley, and the actress Ellen Hanley was his sister.

entities.description: The President of the Republic of Poland is the head of state of Poland. Their rights and obligations are determined in the Constitution of Poland. entities.title: George Braden
entities.description: George Braden was a politician from the Northwest Territories, Canada. Elected as "Government Leader", Braden would retroactively become the second Premier of the Northwest Territories, after a motion was passed in 1994 to change the official title.

entities.title: Premier of the Northwest Territories
entities.description: The premier of the Northwest Territories is the first minister for the Canadian territory of the Northwest Territories. He or she is the territory's head of government and de facto chief executive, although the powers of the office are considerably less than those of a provincial premier.
